fields.description:
{panel}This issue isn't a bug. Due Date display format is set in the _Day Format_ option, and not _Complete Date/Time Format_. The former will applied to e.g. Updated and Resolved dates.{panel}

h5.summary
Regardless of the settings under *JIRA Admin > System > Look and Feel*, Due Date is always displayed in the default format (_dd/MMM/yy_). This is an issue when 

h5.Steps to reproduce
# go to *JIRA Admin > System > Look and Feel* and modify the *Complete Date/Time Format* setting;
# open any Issue with _Due Date_ set.

+*Expected result:*+ all Date fields are displayed according to global settings.
+*Actual result:*+ although other fields (_Created_, _Updated_ etc.) are displayed correctly, _Due Date_ ignores the look & feel settings.
fields.summary: Due Date formatting ignores global configuration

fields.description: In Jira 6 RC1, when you mention a user in a comment, and afterwards rename the user (new functionality), the mention in the comment is not valid anymore - which means the users displayname is not rendered - the new user key should be stored in the comment instead of the username.
fields.summary: @Mention of renamed User is not valid anymore

fields.description:
When viewing the dashboard, it is not possible to delete the dashboard when selecting the delete option, from the Tools dropdown

# navigate to new dashboard
# go to Tools
# select "Delete Dashboard" dropdown

*expected result*
dashboard should get deleted
*actual result*
when selecting "Delete Dashboard" nothing happens

*Workarounds:*
* Delete dashboard from Manage Dashboard section
* Open link on a new tab
fields.summary: Dashboard delete option in the Tools dropdown is non fuctional

fields.description:
Problem was probably introduced by a [Chrome update|http://googlechromereleases.blogspot.com.br/2013/07/stable-channel-update_30.html] released on July the 30th. Seems to only affect JIRA.
h2. Workaround
Disabling the [Chrome's Google Tag assistant plugin|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tag-assistant-by-google/kejbdjndbnbjgmefkgdddjlbokphdefk?hl=en] seems to solve the problem.

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Configure your screen scheme so that when you edit an issue the resolution field appears
# Create a new issue
# Edit the issue and set the resolution field to any value (eg 'Fixed')

Result:

The field is updated, but JIRA does not consider the issue to be resolved.

Expected Result:

The field should be updated and the issue should be resolved.

Workarounds:

# If you add a comment while editing the field then it will resolve the issue.
# If you change the resolution value when transitioning an issue (not as a post-function) it will resolve the issue.
# If you set the resolution value in a post-function it will resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Editing an issue to set a resolution does not resolve the issue

fields.description:
When viewing an issue details, clicking the Remote Attachments tab full refreshes the page then returns to the last viewed tab, instead of load the remote attachments tab content.

Steps to reproduce:
* Login on JIRA with IE8 or IE9
* View an issue details
* Click Remote Attachments tab
fields.summary: Remote Attachments tab not loading on IE 8 and IE 9

fields.description:
When clicking the 'show open' option for subtasks the view does not change

Steps to replicate:

# Create an issue
# Create two sub-tasks for that issue
# Transition one of those two sub-tasks to 'closed'
# Go back to the original issue and click the drop down in the top right of the sub-tasks
# Click 'show open'

Result: 

The page reloads, and both issues are showing. If you hit the drop down again you'll see that it still says 'show all'

Expected result:

The page should reload and only the issues that are open should be shown, the drop down should show that 'show open' is selected
fields.summary: Show Open sub-tasks functionality does not work

fields.description:
When the amount of issues in a given status corresponds to less than 1% of the total issues, the Status Summary panel on the Issues tab of the Browse Project page doesn't show any percentage value and the sum of the other statuses corresponds to 100%.

See image for more details.
fields.summary: Status Summary is rounding values and doesn't show percentage

fields.description:
Even if the column is specified in the "Issue Navigator Column" it still is not displayed in the issue navigator.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create custom field of type "Select List" (screen1)
2. Go to to Issue "Navigator Columns" and add the column ("complexity" in my case) (screen2)
3. Go to "Issue Navigator" -> no custom field is shown.

Issue 1: No custom field is shown in "Issue Navigator"
Issue 2: The field is too wide in "Issue Navigator Columns" (looks like the width is according to the field description, shouldn't be like that)

Do not hesitate to ask for more information.
fields.summary: Custom fields are not displayed in issue navigator

fields.description:
Usually, and in older versions of JIRA, within a Project's Administration Summary, there were, and still there are most, links to view/edit the option that is within a section. 
For example, within Workflows, one can click on the Default Workflow Scheme, or the default workflow active, even there is a "pencil" button to edit the workflow next to it.

However, within the Versions section, when there is no version created there is a link to "Add a version", but after a version a created no more "clickable" option/s are available within the Versions section. There should be a "More" link within it to manage the current version/s.


The specific version is the following:
Version 6.0-OD-09-4
fields.summary: Within a Project's Administration Summary, whenever there's a version created, the links are gone

Create a Support ticket to have Atlassian Support restart JIRA, this will  fix this issue and will make sure dashboards and pages loads correctly.

- On the resulting dialog, click on *Configure Fields*  and then click on *Where's my field?*.

!people.png|thumbnail!

Expected Behavior:

fields.description:
h5.to reproduce
- Add 3000 worklog entries and then goto the worklog panel, wait a long time. Add a new work log while on this panel,  wait a *very, very, very long while* (If you are just on the comment panel, you can add a worklog in sensible time.)
- In Tempo TImesheets plugin, try to fetch a report for multiple issues and a time period long enough to include thousands of worklog entries

This may cause JIRA to run out of memory altogether. 

*Possible workaround:*
If you are using the tempo plugin, fetch reports for shorter periods of time. If the default settings are set to a long time span, visit this URL: YOUR_SERVER/secure/TempoUserBoard!timesheet.jspa?periodView=WEEK to get a weekly report.
fields.summary: Displaying the worklog panel or a report with a very large number of worklog entries is a complete fail

fields.description:
When using the component field in the issue collector form with Mozilla Firefox 20.0.1, Google Chrome 23.0.1 and Internet Explorer 9 the box for selecting the value is not behaving correctly.

In all three browsers, every time you select a value, the field becomes larger. 

Moreover, while using IE, the field is just too small, so you can't see what you're typing. See screenshots below:

*Firefox and Chrome*

At a first glance, the field looks fine.

!fc.png!

After selecting one Component value, it becomes larger.

!fc2.png!

After selecting two Component values it becomes even larger. The more components you add, the larger it becomes (it seems to be growing exponentially).

!fc3.png!

*Internet Explorer*

At a first glance the field does not seem to be correct, it looks too small, so you can't see what you're typing.

!ie_1.png!

After selecting a Component value, it behaves incorrectly, the same way when you're using the other browsers.

!ie_2.png!
fields.summary: Problem with using Component field in Issue Collector

fields.description:

The custom field should be displayed 

h3. Actual Result

The custom field is not displayed on any issue, even an issue matching second more specific context.

Delete the second context

fields.description:
When you export a series of tickets to excel for viewing/editing the Original Time and Remaining Time values that are exported are wrong.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Conduct your favorite search in your JIRA project to get a list of relevant tickets
2. Use the Export to Excel (all fields) function on this list of tickets
3. Review the Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate fields for accuracy

Expected Results: The values in these time fields should be the same as the values in JIRA

Obtained Results: After converting the values in these fields to hours (they are initially in seconds) you notice that they are off by 1 hour. 

i.e. In JIRA the ticket JRA-XYZ has an original estimate of 1 day, in the exported file this is shown as 9 hours instead of 8 hours


*NOTE:* In the Time Tracking section of JIRAs admin a single day is set to be 8 hours, not 9 hours
fields.summary: Wrong Time Value Exported to Excel

How to reproduce:
1. go to http://$jira/$contextPath/secure/ConvertIssue.jspa?id=1)%20Please%20login%20again%20at%20https://attacker.com%20
2. observe that the id parameter value is found html encoded below in the error message.

fields.description:
_(JIRA OnDemand - Using Chrome and MAC OSX)_

Located a user that is assigned an issue, then went to Notification Helper. In the dialog box I enter:

Username
Issue Key
Notification Event - Issue Assigned

Result - *The user and Issue Key fields do not autofill*. 

Workaround:

Open another browser tab and locate the same user assigned to the issue
Open the issue
Copy the issue key to clipboard
Switch back to the Notification help in the previous tab
Start typing in the issue 

The issue field will immediately autofill with said issue.
fields.summary: Notification Helper - User and Issue Autofill

fields.description:
Users and groups are not correctly imported by the Studio Importer if there is existing data on the instance.

Other entities are handled via JIRA's normal restore functionality, which blows everything away before importing the new data. However, with users and groups, there is OnDemand-specific logic to synchronise the imported data with the Crowd directory. This logic is incomplete, in that it doesn't update attributes of existing users, does not remove users, and only creates new group membership entries (does not remove any).

This impacts JIRA Enterprise hosted to OnDemand migrations. Details here: https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-1935?focusedCommentId=20853&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-20853

The solution is to delete all users (except the admin performing the import and sysadmin) and all groups (except the initial set of groups expected on OnDemand) at the beginning of the Studio import process.
fields.summary: Studio Import does not update users and groups correctly if there is existing data on the instance

fields.description:
If a JIRA mail handler encounters a UTF encoding error, no issue will be created, but the {{pcounter}} of a project will still be incremented. The mail will never be removed from the inbox so the mail handler will try to process the mail constantly.

Because the mail is never removed, the ticket IDs will be incremented constantly, causing some strange jumps when creating tickets.

{noformat}

(ERROR: invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00
  Hint: This error can also happen if the byte sequence does not match the encoding expected by the server, which is controlled by "client_encoding".))

fields.description:
If your permission scheme adds a custom field group multi select to the browse projects permission, and an issue includes a group in this field, a user in that group does NOT have that permission.

So:
1. Create Custom Field group multi picker and add to issue screens
2. Add that Custom Field to the Browse Projects permission on a permission scheme
3. Add list of groups to this picker
4. Run permission checker on a user in one of those groups that would not otherwise have access and it shows that they do not have access through that group picker
fields.summary: When using group multi select custom field to add groups to permission scheme, it fails to extend permissions

fields.description:
Problem happens with JIRA 6.3, it's already in production for OnDemand.

Using JiraAuthenticationContext.getI18nHelper().getText() for plugin messages is broken - plugin messages are not resolved since JIRA 6.3.

See https://timesheet-report-release.jira-dev.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa for example and screen shot attached for visible problem.

Is it something that can be fixed in plugin? 

Note, atlassian-plugin.xml has the following:
    <resource type="i18n" name="i18n-timesheet" location="com.fdu.jira.plugin.portlet.timesheet.timesheet_portlet" />

to load corresponding messages, and it used to work for plugin in all cases, Velocity templates, WebWork actions and REST resources. Now, all cases beside REST resources still work fine.

Thank you.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Plugin rest resources can not resolve text messages using I18nHelper

fields.description:
*Reproduction*
* Create an Issue Type Scheme containing no issue types
* Access https://<instance>/secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa
* Select 'Add incoming mail handler'
* First dialog is rendered correctly (first_popup_screen)
* When selecting 'Next' the screen remain grey.  Elements shows the 'visibility: hidden;' (incoming_mail_handler_not_displayed)

With disabled minification the results indicated an issue with the issue type when performing the action (Debug 1).

*Workaround*
Update the Issue Type Scheme on the affected projects to a scheme that contains at least one issue type
fields.summary: Incoming mail handler configuration not allowed when no issues types are associated to a project

fields.description:
{{allowedIPAccresses}} is passed unfiltered into the results page. Contents of the field persist through the "missing XSRF token" screen, so exploitation is trivial - just get your victim to click on the link without a token. {noformat} /secure/admin/TempoServicesAccess.jspa?allowedIpAddresses=%3Cxss%3E&atl_token=BYRO-9FU9-UCXC-E6R7%7C1abd1e4580f1776e7c4a257414640e59c92fc1b0%7Clin&atl_token_retry_button=Retry+Operation {noformat} Response (output appears in 2 places in the page) {code:html}
Misprint in Allowed addresses? Please check and save again. The offending input:
Allowed addresses {code} This is probably in Tempo See fixing HOWTO at https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SECCOUNCIL/HOWTO+-+Fixing+JIRA+Security+Issues

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*

# On an OnDemand instance add an incoming mail server with a valid host
# Create a backup using the OnDemand backup manager
# Import that backup into another instance (an OnDemand one for example)

*Result*

The mail server you created in step 1 has is now using 'localhost' as the host instead of the value previously entered

*Expected Result*

Mail server values are retained. The built-in mail server may not want to be retained, but any custom servers should be.

fields.description:
If I use the Create Issue dialog and enter some data, ESC -- apparently a shortcut for Cancel -- causes a dialog to appear asking me whether I am sure I want to discard my work.  Great.

Unfortunately the same does not happen when I use the Resolve Issue dialog -- ESC just blithely throws away whatever notes I have made about a fix, its limitations, associated tests, etc.  Perhaps because I'm a heavy VIM user, this has happened to me several times accidentally.

Could ESC in the Resolve Issue dialog please be changed to do the same "are you sure?" verification as the Create Issue dialog?  Or if that's hard, could ESC simply not be a shortcut for Cancel?
fields.summary: ESC aborts Resolve Issue dialog without "are you sure?"

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*

# Create a commit on Bitbucket referencing a valid JIRA OnDemand issue
# View the commits tab on the JIRA OnDemand issue referenced in step 1

*Result:*

Commits in Bitbucket for some repositories will not appear in JIRA.

*Expected result:*

Commits should appear in the commits tab.

*Note*

Do not delete your DVCS configuration as historical commits will be temporarily lost for the duration of this issue.

We are working to resolve this bug as a high priority and all updates regarding estimated time of resolution will be posted here. Please watch this issue to be notified of the latest updates.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand Issues not receiving commit messages from Bitbucket

fields.description:
h5.steps to reproduce
# Edit an inactive Workflow in the diagram mode;
# click one of the transitions and try to access Properties, Conditions, Validators or Post Functions.

*Result:* 404 error "Oops, you've found a dead link."

This affects all inactive workflows, created from scratch and copied from active ones.

*+Workaround:+* use the _Text_ mode of the editor, as it's not affected.
fields.summary: 404 error when editing transitions in an inactive workflow

fields.description:
When customer checking using the permission helper why a user cannot close an issue, it shows the user having permission to close the issue which missed out the information that the user also need the Transition Issue Permission.

Furthermore, the tools also lack of option to check if the user has permission to *Transition Issues*.

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+Project+Permissions

*Note*
Currently only available in AOD instance and EAP.
fields.summary: Permission Helper Lack of Transition Issues Project Permission Checking

fields.description: A number of actions in JIRA were vulnerable to CSRF as they performed no token checking. These actions are protected by websudo, which makes exploiting them impossible.
fields.summary: Several actions vulnerable to CSRF (have websudo protection)

fields.description:
Project's attachment directory remained after project has been deleted. The content of it is deleted anyway.

For some cases, there will be attachment thumbnails left behind.
fields.summary: Project's attachment directory remained after project has been deleted

fields.description:
1. Create a new group named "><script>alert("XSS")</script>
2. In the OnDemand administration section click Fisheye, then Configure to the right of the project name

This vulnerability is due to an unescaped group.name parameter in projectrepositorypermissions.vm

e.g. https://iceberg.jira-dev.com/secure/admin/ProjectRepositoryPermissions.jspa?repositoryKey=SCR

Note that this issue is about a different template to JRA-29686.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in source tab configure project

fields.description:
Administrators should be able to link a JIRA project with a Confluence space, but this can only be done by sysadmin.

Steps to reproduce (logged in as admin):
1. Create JIRA project (key test)
2. Create space for test and test2
3. Change Confluence space setting to test2 in JIRA Project admin
4. Go to Configure Project Links to add test2
   ***This is not allowed, either you get the message that the available links have been used or there is a permissions problem.  This can, however, be done by sysadmin.
fields.summary: Project Links not working properly for administrators

fields.description: When I try and move the gadgets around on my homepage they end up getting attached to my mouse and I cannot drop them back into place. Usually works for the first few seconds then its stuck on my mouse.
fields.summary: Gadgets that are being dragged get stuck to the mouse.

fields.description:
With the JIRA OnDemand upgrade to version: 6.2-OD-07-027, customers are unable to edit, delete, or move a JIRA worklogs entry in particular projects. Clicking the Delete button gives an error message as per attached screen-shot. 

Similar issue is reported from the Tempo team here: https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-314
fields.summary: Tempo Worklogs can't be moved or splitted

fields.description:
As a result of HTMLSafe being turned on by default, Balsamiq Mockups 2.2.6 contains the following double escaped values:
* Status Message
* Warning if required message
* Licensed users group message

!balsamiq_licensing_page.png!

Please ensure you follow the [Velocity Templates guide here|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Velocity+Templates] to ensure that all values in Licensing Page Velocity template are not double escaped.
fields.summary: Fixes required for HTMLSafe compatibility - Balsamiq 2.2.6 Licensing Page

fields.description: As per screenshot attached, the help icon appears as a D instead of a question mark in Windows 7 when using IE 8. See screenshot for details.
fields.summary: Help icon appears as a D in Windows 7/IE 8

fields.description:
An attacker is able to perform bruteforce attacks via the applinks servlet. There is no captcha protection, nor do accounts get locked out after excessive attempts.

The attacker can input a username, and perform bruteforce attacks on the login form. The core issue is that there is no login attempt limitation for an attacker.

The bruteforce attack can be executed through the form on:
{{https://example.com/plugins/servlet/applinks/login}} on a standard JIRA installation.

This vulnerability was reported by Nir Goldshlager {{ngoldshlager@salesforce.com}}.
fields.summary: Bruteforce Attack via Applinks Servlet

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
# Create a custom event using *Issue Created* template (for example 'Custom Issue Created') 
# In the workflow, exactly in the *Create Issue* transition change the post function {{Fire a Issue Created event that can be processed by the listeners.}} to use the custom event has been created earlier in the first step (for example 'Custom Issue Created') .
# Create an issue.


*Actual Results*
The issue is not visible in the issue navigator or even the activity stream even though is accessible from the URL.


*Expected Results*   
The issue once is created should visible in the issue navigator or the activity stream (normal behavior of JIRA).


*Workaround*
* Change the custom event to use the *system default* events.
* Or after the ticket is created, you can edit any of the fields that will result of the issue to be visible everywhere (in my case 'Component' field was doing the trick).
fields.summary: Creating the issue using 'custom event' will result the issue to be invisible in the issue navigator nor the activity stream
Inconsistent "Due Date" field in emails

fields.description:
While importing a CSV file into existing project (defined in CSV), user gets the error message attached, as follows:
{panel:bgColor=#FFCCFF|borderStyle=none}
Invalid project key TP: Project key or name is already used. If you want to import to an existing project the name and the key must match it exactly.
{panel}
What happens in this case is that the project name and key are case sensitive, which means that the second part of the message is accurate ("project the name and the key must match it exactly"), but the first part of this error message is quite confusing, stating that there's an invalid project key, and also that the project name or key are already in use. That does not make sense.

Steps to replicate:
# Create a project named *Test Project*
# Create CSV file such as 
{noformat}
Project Name,Project Key,Summary
TEST PROJECT,TP,testing CSV
{noformat}
(!) Note that the project name in capital letters is intentional
# In JIRA, choose CSV File import, choose the CSV created in step 2, click next
# Select *Defined in CSV* for _Import to JIRA Project_ option, click next
# Map the fields accordingly, click next
# The error is displayed.
fields.summary: User gets an unclear error message while importing CSV file into existing project

fields.description:
On May 26th release, the Create Issue button was renamed to "Create" as outlined at:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/2014/05/23/Upcoming+Atlassian+OnDemand+upgrade+for+week+starting+on+26+May#UpcomingAtlassianOnDemandupgradeforweekstartingon26May-JIRA6.3-OD-05

However, the "Create Issue" button is now missing from inside the "Issues" Menu.

Here's the button displayed on an older version:

!create_issue.png!

And now after the renaming the button:

!missing_create_issue.png!
fields.summary: Create issue button missing inside the "Issues" menu

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start with JIRA < 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0.
# Create a custom issue status, which is created with an ID of 10000.
# Upgrade to JIRA 6.2-OD-3/icebat-85.0.
# Try to create another issue status, and you'll receive a stack trace:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][id,10000][sequence,12][description,null][name,A New Status][statuscategory,1][iconurl,/images/icons/statuses/generic.png] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_issuestatus"))
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:395)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.createValue(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.AbstractIssueConstantsManager.createConstant(AbstractIssueConstantsManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultStatusManager.createStatus(DefaultStatusManager.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.config.DefaultStatusService.createStatus(DefaultStatusService.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.addConstant(ViewStatuses.java:196)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.constants.AbstractViewConstants.doAddConstant(AbstractViewConstants.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.statuses.ViewStatuses.doAddStatus(ViewStatuses.java:134)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
[...]
{code}

Try to create it a second time and it'll work fine, as the new status is then created with an ID of 10001. The more custom issue statuses already exist in an instance, the more times you have to click Add in order to get past the latest ID.

h3. Workaround
If on OnDemand contact support, support will:

# Shutdown JIRA
# Backup the database
# Identify the current maximum value of the issuestatus id
{noformat}
select id::integer from issuestatus order by id desc limit 1;
{noformat}
# Update the sequence_value_item table to define the Status sequence ID as 1 higher than the value identified in the previous step
{noformat}
update sequence_value_item set seq_id = <value from above + 1> where seq_name = 'Status';
{noformat}
# Start JIRA back up.
fields.summary: JRA-35857 applies to mojomaritime.atlassian.net too.

fields.description:
As for the latest release of JIRA, it is not possible to use the *Copy Value From Field to Field* and *Update Issue Field* post functions together.

Steps to reproduce:

- Add a post function *Update Issue Field*. Configure it to have the Assignee set to "Unassigned".
It will be displayed as follows (in a buggy way, but the post function works):
{noformat}
Type: class
Class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction
Arguments:
field.value =
field.name = assignee
{noformat}

- Now, add the post function *Copy Value From Field to Field* and copy the value from the assignee field to a user picker custom field.

Once the last post function is created, it turns into:

{noformat}
 The Field Resolved By will take the value from Assignee .
Edit | Move Down | Delete
— THEN
The Field Resolved By will take the value from Assignee .
Edit | Move Up | Move Down | Delete 
{noformat}

Removing the *Copy Value From Field to Field* makes the other post function goes back to normal:

{noformat}
Type: class
Class: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction
Arguments:
field.value =
field.name = assignee
{noformat}
fields.summary: Problem with post functions

fields.description:
For JIRA only instances (tested with OnDemand), whenever the JIRA tutorial is selected, it isn't possible to progress past step four. Step four is the app switcher bullet and when selected it takes you back to step three. Probably because Confluence isn't activated on the instance.

To reproduce:

- Log in for the first time to a JIRA only instance.
- Select to take the tutorial in the popup.
- Progress through progress bar at top.
- When step four comes up, no popup shows. 
- If you select the link for step four, the step three popup comes up.

And thus users cannot progress through and complete the JIRA tutorial.
fields.summary: JIRA Tutorial Stops on App Switcher Step (step 4) With JIRA Only Instance

*Symptoms*:

Tempo is missing from the top bar, and accessing any tempo page directly results in a 404 error.

*Cause*:

It is suspected that an upgrade today caused Tempo to not come up properly.


*Workaround*:

# Click the cog in the top right of JIRA and select 'Add-ons'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The removal of the option to display the old projects page is causing the sidebar to disappear on attempts to navigate to the Agile tabs of the new projects page ("Backlog" / "Active Sprints") for customers who had chosen to disable the new projects page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the "Backlog" / "Active Sprints" in the sidebar with a user account that had disabled the sidebar in the past.
# Notice the project sidebar is gone.

h3. Expected Results

The project sidebar stays on the left-hand side at all times

h3. Actual Results

The project sidebar disappears.
 
h3. Notes

This issue is affecting production customers that had decided to opt out from the sidebar, and that got the newest version of jira-projects bundled in JIRA 7.0.0-OD-02-247.

h3.Workaround
-Navigate to Reports in the Agile Board and navigate to the projects page again and the sidebar will show up again. This will have to be done again on further attempts to navigate to either the "Backlog"/"Active Sprints" tabs in the sidebar.-

Contact Atlassian Cloud support for a fix for this problem.
fields.summary: Agile sidebar is not rendered after the removal of the option to display the old projects page

fields.description:
After the Salesforce.com application link is created, an additional step is required which is to edit the link and enter your Salesforce.com credentials in the "Outgoing authentication" tab.
However, when a non-sysadmin user edits the link and navigates to this tab, he's greeted with the following message:
{panel}(i) No authentication providers to configure.{panel}
Only users with JIRA System Administrators global permission can view the actual screen that lets us enter our credentials (The screenshot shows the screen sysadmins-only view, but all admin users should view the same screen).


*Workaround*

You will need to have the customer supply the credentials for their SalesForce instance to finish this connection. 

Refer to the following URL for information on connections that require a security token:
https://docs.servicerocket.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=5967258

 A security token is an automatically generated key that you must add to the end of your password in order to log in to Salesforce from an untrusted network. For example, if your password is mypassword, and your security token is XXXXXXXXXX, then you must enter mypasswordXXXXXXXXXX to log in.
fields.summary: Unable to configure Salesforce.com application link
